{{Day}}

==Events==
*[[474]] &ndash; [[Zeno (emperor)|Zeno]] crowned as co-emperor of the [[Byzantine Empire]].
*[[1555]] &ndash; [[Bishop of Gloucester]] [[John Hooper]] is [[burned at the stake]].
*[[1621]] &ndash; [[Pope Gregory XV|Gregory XV]] becomes [[Pope]], the last Pope [[Papal election|elected]] by [[acclamation]].
*[[1654]] &ndash; The [[Capture of Fort Rocher]] takes place during the [[Anglo-Spanish War (1654–60)|Anglo-Spanish War]].
*[[1775]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: The [[Parliament of Great Britain|British Parliament]] declares [[Massachusetts]] in rebellion.
*[[1788]] &ndash; The [[Habsburg Monarchy|Habsburg Empire]] joins the [[Russo-Turkish War (1787–92)|Russo-Turkish War]] in the [[Imperial Russia|Russian]] camp.
*[[1825]] &ndash; After no presidential candidate receives a majority of [[U.S. Electoral College|electoral votes]] in [[United States presidential election, 1824|the election of 1824]], the [[United States House of Representatives]] elects [[John Quincy Adams]] [[President of the United States]].
*[[1849]] &ndash; [[Roman Republic (19th century)|New Roman Republic]] established
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]:  [[Jefferson Davis]] is elected the Provisional President of the [[Confederate States of America]] by the [[Montgomery Convention|Confederate convention]] at [[Montgomery, Alabama]].
*[[1870]] &ndash; President [[Ulysses S. Grant]] signs a [[joint resolution]] of [[United States Congress|Congress]] establishing the [[U.S. Weather Bureau]].
*[[1889]] &ndash; President [[Grover Cleveland]] signs a bill elevating the [[United States Department of Agriculture]] to a [[United States Cabinet|Cabinet]]-level agency.
*[[1895]] &ndash; [[William G. Morgan]] creates a game called [[Mintonette]], which soon comes to be referred to as [[volleyball]].
*[[1900]] &ndash; The [[Davis Cup]] competition is established.
*[[1904]] &ndash; [[Russo-Japanese War]]: [[Battle of Port Arthur]] concludes.
*[[1913]] &ndash; A group of [[meteor]]s [[Meteor procession of February 9, 1913|is visible]] across much of the eastern seaboard of North and South America, leading astronomers to conclude the source had been a small, short-lived [[natural satellite]] of the Earth.
*[[1920]] &ndash; Under the terms of the [[Svalbard Treaty]], international diplomacy recognizes Norwegian sovereignty over Arctic archipelago [[Svalbard]], and designates it as [[demilitarized]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; [[Brazil]] becomes a member of the [[Berne Convention for the Protection of Literary and Artistic Works|Berne Convention]] [[copyright]] treaty.
*[[1934]] &ndash; The [[Balkan Entente]] is formed.
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: Top United States military leaders hold their first formal meeting to discuss American military strategy in the war.
*  1942   &ndash; Year-round [[Daylight saving time]] is re-instated in the United States as a wartime measure to help conserve energy resources.
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] authorities declare [[Guadalcanal (Pacific Ocean island)|Guadalcanal]] secure after [[Empire of Japan|Imperial Japan]] evacuates its remaining forces from the island, ending the [[Battle of Guadalcanal]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: [[Battle of the Atlantic (1939-1945)|The Battle of the Atlantic]] &ndash; {{HMS|Venturer|P68|6}} sinks [[U-864]] off the coast of [[Fedje]], Norway, in a rare instance of submarine-to-submarine combat.
*  1945   &ndash; World War II: A force of [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] aircraft [[Black Friday (1945)|unsuccessfully attacked]] a [[Nazi Germany|German]] destroyer in [[Førdefjorden]], Norway.
*[[1950]] &ndash; [[Second Red Scare]]: [[United States Senate|Senator]] [[Joseph McCarthy]] accuses the [[United States Department of State]] of being filled with [[Communism|Communists]].
*[[1951]] &ndash; [[Korean War]]: [[Geochang massacre]]
*[[1959]] &ndash; The [[R-7 Semyorka]], the first [[intercontinental ballistic missile]], becomes operational at [[Plesetsk]], [[Soviet Union|USSR]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[The Beatles]] make their first appearance on [[The Ed Sullivan Show]], performing before a "record-busting" audience of 73 million viewers.
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: The first United States combat troops are sent to [[South Vietnam]].
*[[1969]] &ndash; First test flight of the [[Boeing 747]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; The [[Sylmar earthquake]] hits the [[San Fernando Valley]] area of [[California]].
*  1971   &ndash; [[Satchel Paige]] becomes the first [[Negro League baseball|Negro League]] player to be voted into the [[Baseball Hall of Fame]].
*  1971   &ndash; [[Apollo program]]: [[Apollo 14]] returns to Earth after the third manned Moon landing.
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Biju Patnaik]] of the [[Pragati Legislature Party]] is elected leader of the opposition in the state assembly in [[Odisha]], India.
*[[1975]] &ndash; The [[Soyuz 17]] [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] [[spacecraft]] returns to Earth.
*[[1986]] &ndash; [[Halley's Comet]] last appeared in the inner [[Solar System]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; Voters in [[Lithuania]] vote for independence.
*[[1996]] &ndash; The [[Provisional Irish Republican Army]] declares the end to its 18-month [[ceasefire]] and [[1996 Docklands bombing|explodes a large bomb]] in London's [[Canary Wharf]].
*[[2001]] &ndash; The American submarine {{USS|Greeneville|SSN-772|6}} accidentally [[Ehime Maru and USS Greeneville collision|strikes and sinks]] the ''Ehime-Maru'', a Japanese training vessel operated by the [[Uwajima Fishery High School]].
